title: Why is the first blood stipulation in the remake rule?
body:
So, I saw that the enemy Lucian was obviously AFK and therefore I walked under tower to give first blood to Morgana... Preventing a remake. Why is it that First Blood stops remakes? It is super easy to prevent them and it is a vote anyway so there isn't much to complain about if you vote to remake even though a lane got an early lead. By walking under tower, a player can turn a possible /remake tie into an almost guaranteed win and therefore make an already annoying situation flat-out grim.


(In the poll I voted yes to see results)

replies.body: First blood scored by the remaking team doesn't stop them from remaking. So they probably just decided not to remake (maybe premades?), but ended up with nothing. That or you are lying.
It is hard to gather data really other than from the complaints in /all chat, so I am going by that.... BUT when I gave Morgana First Blood, I saw complaints that they could not remake in /all
It's possible Lucian hadn't been AFK for the requisite amount of time before the three minute mark, the first blood stipulation would not have prevented them from remaking in any way.

I believe you misunderstand first blood rule. If I understand the rule right, it prevents remake only if someone on the remaking team got killed, so giving first blood should have no effect if I understand patch notes right (can someone confirm it?)
The first blood also only stops it if it's before the person goes afk.  At least, that's how it's supposed to work.

I think that applies to before the notification of AFK goes.... Generally speaking, it is EXTREMELY obvious when the enemy ADC is AFK because the Support would try to farm really hard... This is especially true if the enemy Jungler decided to get leashed in the top jungle.

It may just be that if the vote wasn't started and First Blood was performed... But either way, it will not cancel a vote in progress.

I don't know why all these myths about the /remake are going around.  But you CAN NOT Remake if all 5 members connected AT ALL .  Like  Even if the ADC was only in the game for .00005 seconds at the start and DC'd, you CAN NOT REMAKE.  It's only usable if a member has never ever connected even once, by the 3 minute mark.


The first blood part I'm unsure on, but the above is probably why they can't remake.
Not true, if you sit at base and don't move, you can type, you just cant shop or move, it'll prompt.
